Home TV TV News I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here TV This Morning's Phillip Schofield told to 'calm down' over Holly Willoughby The This Morning host was 'warned' by Rochelle Humes after he got a little too excited This is a modal window. Beginning of dialog window. Escape will cancel and close the window. End of dialog window. This is a modal window. This modal can be closed by pressing the Escape key or activating the close button. This is a modal window. This modal can be closed by pressing the Escape key or activating the close button. Phillip Schofield ' s excitement got the better of him on This Morning today - even prompting co-host Rochelle Humes to try to get him to  " calm down " . Rochelle, 29, is currently standing in for Holly Willoughby while she presents I ' m A Celebrity with Declan Donnelly in Australia. And today Phil revealed that he would be facing a challenge that Holly had already tackled. The 56-year-old presenter was hoping that he could beat her time of 18 seconds, but ended up getting chastised over his enthusiasm. While giving viewers a run-down of what to expect from today ' s show, he said:  " After Holly took on the Willoughby Wallaby Wobbly Willoughby game… " As Rochelle praised his ability to say the tongue-twister, he quipped:  " See they haven’t let me have any practice at all. " " And he’s asked by the way, "  Rochelle said wryly. Phil exclaimed:  " I have, I have asked because I’m sure Holly will have done exactly the same in the Jungle. " Noting that Phil was almost bouncing up and down about taking part in the game, Rochelle told him:  " Calm down! " But Phil insisted:  " She will have had a practice! " The pair laughed as Phil shook his head and knowingly said:  " I won ' t beat her time. " Later on in the show, Phil took part in the challenge which saw him face a number of images flashing up on the screen. He had to identify whether they were a wallaby, Holly Willoughby or a wobbly piece of jelly. Phil just about managed to beat Holly, with Rochelle and Gino failing to match his quick time. *This Morning airs weekdays at 10.30am on ITV  Do you have a story to sell? Get in touch with us at  webtv@trinitymirror.com  or call us direct 0207 29 33033
